Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. Taste the Best of Southern Cuisine at Rose Villa in Ormond Beach | Ormond Beach Connect Skip to the content Ormond Beach Connect Presented by TownSites News & Articles Local Directory Connect With Us Search for: News & Articles Local Directory Connect With Us News & Articles Local Directory Connect With Us Connect Debbie Weller Realtor The Weller Team Ormond Beach Connect Ormond Beach, FL Community Taste the Best of Southern Cuisine at Rose Villa in Ormond Beach by Debbie Weller on January 22, 2025 Rose Villa Restaurant, Southern Table and Bar is a delightful spot in Ormond Beach, Florida , where Southern charm meets culinary excellence. If you’re considering a move to this beautiful area, let me take you on a virtual tour of what makes Rose Villa not just a restaurant but a community experience. A Taste of Southern Comfort As you step into Rose Villa, you’re greeted by an atmosphere that feels both polished and relaxed. This historic building, dating back to the late 1800s, was originally a bed and breakfast for guests visiting the nearby Daytona Beach. Today, it serves as a beacon of Southern hospitality, offering a menu that showcases classic comfort food with a twist. Whether you’re craving Southern fried chicken , shrimp, and grits , or lobster mac and cheese , every dish is crafted to evoke nostalgia while tantalizing your taste buds. The restaurant prides itself on using fresh ingredients to create hearty meals that feel like home. Imagine sinking your teeth into crispy fried green tomatoes or savoring the rich flavors of jambalaya—each bite is a warm embrace from the South. Cocktails and More No Southern dining experience is complete without a refreshing cocktail. At Rose Villa, the bar is adorned with ornamental touches that reflect its historic roots. Here, you can enjoy expertly crafted cocktails that complement your meal perfectly. Whether you’re in the mood for a classic Moscow mule or something more adventurous, the drink menu has something for everyone. If you’re looking for a place to unwind after a long day or celebrate a special occasion, the outdoor seating area is ideal. Picture yourself sipping on a cocktail while enjoying the gentle Florida breeze—it’s an experience that truly enhances your dining adventure. Dining Options Galore Rose Villa offers various dining options to suit your needs. You can choose to dine indoors surrounded by Victorian decor or opt for the outdoor patio under the gazebo, which often features live music. For those seeking privacy, there’s also a private dining room available for special events. The restaurant operates daily from 12 PM to 8:30 PM and extends its hours until 9 PM on Fridays and Saturdays. This flexibility allows you to plan your visit at your convenience—whether it’s for lunch, dinner, or even brunch on weekends. Community Spirit What sets Rose Villa apart is its commitment to community engagement. The restaurant hosts various events throughout the year, including wine tastings paired with exquisite meals and live music nights that bring locals together. It’s not just about food; it’s about creating memories and fostering connections within the community. Many patrons have shared their experiences of celebrating milestones at Rose Villa—from birthdays to anniversaries—making it a cherished spot for both residents and visitors alike. The staff here are known for their friendliness and attentiveness, ensuring that every guest feels like part of the family. Why Ormond Beach? Living in Ormond Beach means having access to not only incredible dining experiences like Rose Villa but also beautiful beaches, parks, and vibrant local culture. The area boasts a rich history and offers plenty of outdoor activities such as biking along scenic trails or enjoying water sports on the Atlantic Ocean. With its warm climate and friendly atmosphere, Ormond Beach is an inviting place to call home. The blend of natural beauty and community spirit creates an environment where residents can thrive. Discover Your New Favorite Spot If you’re contemplating relocating to Ormond Beach or just looking for a new favorite dining destination, make sure to visit Rose Villa Restaurant, Southern Table and Bar. With its delicious Southern cuisine, inviting atmosphere, and commitment to community engagement, it’s more than just a meal; it’s an experience waiting to be had. So why not gather some friends or family and make plans to enjoy what Rose Villa has to offer? You might just find yourself falling in love with both the food and the charming town of Ormond Beach! https://www.rosevillaormondbeach.com Online Social Profiles Phone Number Show Phone Number Call: 386-615-7673 Location 43 W Granada Blvd. Ormond Beach , Florida About  Rose Villa Restaurant, Southern Table and Bar Rose Villa is a unique historic restaurant located in Ormond Beach, Florida, offering a comfortable and polished casual atmosphere with Southern hospitality. Our restaurant features Southern-inspired cuisine, including our signature southern fried chicken, classic craft cocktails, and a wide selection of wines. Built in the late 1800s, Rose Villa was established as a bed and breakfast in 1901, serving important guests who preferred more privacy than the famous Ormond Hotel. After thriving for many years, the building became a real estate office and eventually suffered from its age. However, it was purchased by Bill Jones in 2007, who transformed the original Rose Villa into the Victorian jewel it is today. Rose Villa offers a unique dining experience with restored areas of the building, such as the Veranda and the Gazebo, which are open for cocktails, lunch, and dinner during the temperate months. Additionally, our media room, equipped with a large monitor for presentations and videos, is available for private parties and dinner meetings. We are currently working to weatherize both areas to extend our outdoor season. If you're looking for an unforgettable dining experience in Ormond Beach, Florida, come to Rose Villa. Our managing partner Kirt Roberts and proprietors Hal & Cindy Gerow thank you for joining us and invite you to share your experience by reviewing us.
